item.title: Commands.java Help!
item.dc:creator: @elite_expert elite expert
item.description:
@elite_expert wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:11, topic:527225”][code=java]
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“update”)) {

  1.                                        String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

  2.                                        int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);

  3.                                        PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;

  4.                                        PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;

  5.                                        PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;

  6.                                        PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

  7.                                }

  8.                                if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && (c.playerRights == 3)) {

  9.                                        String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

  10.                                        int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);

  11.                                        PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;

  12.                                        PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;

  13.                                        PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;

  14.                                        PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

  15.                                }

[/code]Why do you have 2 update commands.[/quote]
lol cuz idk what 1 works

Read full topic

item.title: Commands.java Help!
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[code=java]
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“update”)) {

  1.                                        String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

  2.                                        int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);

  3.                                        PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;

  4.                                        PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;

  5.                                        PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;

  6.                                        PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

  7.                                }

  8.                                if (playerCommand.startsWith("update") && (c.playerRights == 3)) {

  9.                                        String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

  10.                                        int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);

  11.                                        PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;

  12.                                        PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;

  13.                                        PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;

  14.                                        PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

  15.                                }

[/code]Why do you have 2 update commands.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands.java Help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“elite expert, post:9, topic:527225”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=645971.msg4344515#msg4344515 date=1375674180]

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) { c.getPA().startTeleport(x, y, 0, "modern"); }Instead of using Config.START_LOCATION_X or whatever, just replace it with the X coordinate of your home location.
[/quote]
well yeah i could do that but the other commands like i have a ::commands 1 that shows the commands that doesnt show up it use to but just randomly stopped working also like ::update that stopped working it use to work[/quote]
::commands stopped working because it looks like this:

                        if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("commands") && c.playerRights == 0) {
                                c.sendMessage("@red@Commands");
                                c.sendMessage("::players, ::home, ::donate, ::vote, ::rules, ::forums");
                                c.sendMessage("@red@Training Teleports");
                                c.sendMessage("::train, ::brimhaven");
                                c.sendMessage("::slaytower, ::taverly");
                                c.sendMessage("@red@MiniGame Teleports");
                                c.sendMessage("::barrows, ::tzhaar, ::pestcontrol");
                                c.sendMessage("@red@Boss Teleports");
                                c.sendMessage("::dagkings, ::kbd(not wildy), ::kalphite");
                                c.sendMessage("@red@Skilling Teleports");
                                c.sendMessage("::mining, ::smithing, ::fishing");
                                c.sendMessage("::agility, ::wc, ::farming");
                        }

&& c.playerRights == 0 means only people with player rights of 0 can use…

Read full topic

item.title: Commands.java Help!
item.dc:creator: @Learning_Code Learning Code
item.description:
@Learning_Code wrote:

if (playerCommand.equals("home") && c.playerRights >= 0) { c.getPA().startTeleport(Config.START_LOCATION_X, Config.START_LOCATION_Y, 0, "modern"); }

Sorry, about the extra bracket I misstyped it.

And it wasn’t working I figured that might fix it, I’m still new to this but that was my attempt at it.

@Null

This is why I posted up the conditional operator

Well, you're using playerCommand.equals, so if you have any capitals it won't work. The only other reason I could see it not working is because you put it in one of the parts you (might) have made for donor only commands or something similar.

Read full topic

Replace that string with this one, easiest solution most of the time.[/quote]What’s the point of the conditional operators? There’s also an extra opening bracket.
